title.native: 夜桜四重奏 ～ホシノウミ～

description:
An OVA based on the Hoshi no Umi arc of the manga spanning chapters 26-34.

This arc focuses on Rin Azuma, a Jiang-Shi yokai resident of Sakurashin adjusting to her new life in the city and working for a ramen shop. One day her former friend Zakuro Kurumaki invades Sakurashin to capture Rin and convince her to join her in destroying the city with the other yokai hunters as well as Enjin Hiizumi, the main antagonist of the series. Akina Hiizumi and the other members of the Hiizumi Life Counseling Office take action to save Rin, 'tune' the yokai controlling Zakuro and protect the city.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

title.native: 夜桜四重奏～ヨザクラカルテット～
夜桜四重奏 ～ヨザクラカルテット～
夜桜四重奏 ~ハナノウタ~

node.description: Originating from [Studio Deen](https://anilist.co/studio/37/) where he studied under [Atsuko Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/102141/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/235154812) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/30949)

Started out as amateur gif animator before turning professional. He initially failed an examination test for [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) but was later scouted by the late [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100406/) for [Beck](https://anilist.co/anime/57/). There he met noted animators [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/), the former which he would work with on numerous occasions afterwards.

His breakthrough as an animator was on [Noein](https://anilist.co/anime/584/), a series directed by [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/). The 12th episode was highly regarded by animation fans and other animators for the given display by him and Matsumoto. He would later also serve as a character designer on [Birdy the Mighty: Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/), another series directed by Akane.

His dedication for animation could also be seen on [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/), for which he animated a minute-long scene of the main character running down a street. He went on the actual street in Tokyo to film himself for reference footage for the cut.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/2256470167)

After graduating from high school, Kubota went through training at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s research center before dropping out and joining [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/) in 1998. Three years later in he met [Sushio](https://anilist.co/staff/103619/) at Comiket, which led to Kubota joining [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). There he made his debut as an animation director on the premiere of [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/277/)'s second season.

In 2005, he made his debut as a character designer, although still jointly together with Sushio and [Takaaki Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/110187/), on the 6th [One Piece](https://anilist.co/anime/464/) movie. The film was directed by Mamoru Hosoda, which led to Kubota getting an invite to join the production of [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/) as an animation director. After this he kept working at Gainax until going freelance.

In 2012, he worked as the main character designer on [From the New World](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/) and [Robotics;Notes](https://anilist.co/anime/13599/), and a few years later he served as one on [One-Punch Man](https://anilist.co/anime/21087/), which earned him international fame.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/145049847)

**Birthplace:** Towada, Aomori Prefecture, Japan

__Biography:__
Junji Ishiwatari is a guitarist, lyricist and music producer. He was the guitarist of the rock band SUPERCAR, until they broke up in 2005. 

Ishiwatari has worked wtih [Chatmonchy](https://anilist.co/staff/105025), [9mm Parabellum Bullet](https://anilist.co/staff/126805), [Negoto](https://anilist.co/staff/148616), [NICO Touches the Walls](https://anilist.co/staff/103965), etc.
[Twitter](http://twitter.com/i/user/128364216)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yama_ic)

Yamashita is one of the key figures of the "Web Generation," being among the first to be recruited within the industry not after formal training but after demonstrating his talent by posting animated gifs online.

His first time standing out of the crowd was on [Birdy the Mighty Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/Birdy-the-Mighty-Decode/). His animation favors expression above all else, to the point characters often bend out of shape when exposed to extreme forces and speeds. 

Despite this he still has a keen eye for delicate and realistic character animation, inspired by the likes of [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/Norio-Matsumoto), as demonstrated on both EDs for Birdy the Mighty Decode and [Shinsekai yori](https://anilist.co/anime/13125/From-the-New-World/) where he handled all aspects of the animation production. 

He is also adept in post production work, often handling the photography, coloring and even CG in his own works.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/isao__hayashi)

Originating from [Nakamura Production](https://anilist.co/studio/6658/Nakamura-Production). Affiliated with [Cloverworks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/880805780844183553)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). 

Freelancer originating from [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/), formerly a [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) employee. 

Married to [Akira Amemiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100956/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/880805780844183553)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). 

Freelancer originating from [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/), formerly a [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) employee. 

Married to [Akira Amemiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100956/).
Affiliated with [Yostar Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6371/).

name.native: ユニゾン・スクエア・ガーデン

node.description: Website | Twitter Unison Square Garden, stylized as UNISON SQUARE GARDEN, is a 3 member boy band under the record label TOY'S FACTORY (formerly under UK PROJECT). Members: - Kousuke Saitou (斎藤宏介) (Vocal & Guitar) - [Tomoya Tabuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/148232/Tomoya-Tabuchi) (田淵智也) (Vocal & Bass) - Takao Suzuki (鈴木貴雄) (Vocal & Drums) (Source: jpop.fandom.com)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/71842765)

After working for Square Enix and Production I.G, he joined Toei Animation in 2010. He is challenging himself to create works that transcend genres, from realistic to cel-style.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/suzupin) | [Tumblr](https://suzupin.tumblr.com/)

Yasuda began drawing when he was 19 years old, after being inspired by [Range Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/98445/Range-Murata)'s pictures. As an illustrator he usually works with novels, providing the cover art and illustrations. He also makes logo designs for companies and games.  He also works on Range Murata's Robot, where he did the chapters: "Ebony & Ivory (Volume 1 & 2)" and "Minus R (Volume 4)"; despite having different names they are part of the same storyline.
